title: Sans font used in advertisement
content:
I am hoping someone will be able to identify the font that is used in this advertisement.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103845im_/http:/typophile.com/files/adver_6315.png)

 [‹ please help id this, Thanks!](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103845/http:/typophile.com/node/50781 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can you identify font please? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103845/http:/typophile.com/node/50776 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Capnhud

comments.content:
Ok is it [victory neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103845/http:/www.plazm.com/design/brand/victory-neue).

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

\> victory neue

Needs optical correction.

hhp
thanks for finding it capnhud... it was really bugging me, the ’2’ is just so wrong, it didn’t fit any of the typefaces that matched the other letters!

@brett  
<cite> it didn’t fit any of the typefaces that matched the other letters!</cite>

At first I thought it was Gotham, but quickly disqualified that once I compared the glyphs. What did you think it was?

@hrant  
<cite>Needs optical correction.</cite>

Not sure I follow what you mean.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

That font seems to need careful thinning at the joins - like look at the intersections of the lines and circles in “b” etc. You’d think Nike is big enough to have gotten it done right.

hhp
